alert.note: Alert for McIntosh; Okmulgee; Pittsburg (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 23 at 7:48PM CDT until September 23 at 11:00PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of northeast and southeast Oklahoma, including the following counties, in northeast Oklahoma, Okmulgee. In southeast Oklahoma, McIntosh and Pittsburg. * WHEN...Until 1000 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 748 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen from previous storms. - Additional intense downpours with rainfall rates in excess of 2 inches per hour are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Henryetta... Dewar... Schulter... Canadian... Indianola... Hanna... Raiford... Vivian... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
